availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Worked as a lawyer and farmer in Nicholas County. Active in the Emancipation Movement, serving as the secretary of a meeting in Carlisle in 1849.

Spouse: Lizzie Ross
Children: John M Ross, Columbia Ross, E. Henry Ross, Mary Ross, W. P. Ross

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Carlisle, page 4.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Carlisle, Precinct 4, page 5.
The Examiner, "Emancipation Meeting in Nicholas County," June 02, page 3.
U.S. Civil War Draft Registration Records, 1863-1865, Kentucky, Seventh District, Volume 2, page 12.
